Articles.Content:
Hey all, 

I have no clue if this should be in here or addon discussions, but here goes:

I just got KAS/KIS and desperately wanted to use the kerbal EVA inventory, because I could remove helmets and refuel airplanes without the pain of docking.The issue is that I have no inventory to use.  I right-clicked Doddard(an engineer and dedicated fuel tanker technician) and went to click the Inventory button, but there was none there.  Next, I tried to find the inventory button on one of those side mount containers(with some tools inside).  Thankfully the inventory button showed.  I clicked on it and nothing happened. Again.  This is weird because the inventories work in the SPH/VAB and on loaded vessels/cockpits.  Any help would be nice.

Thanks, GKSP

Yeah I have a very similar problem. I installed KAS and KIS, and when I went to choose a container, it came up with Sounds/KIS/Container/ContainerB/Open as (it said 'as' obviously it is a spelling mistake and should be 'has' but anyway) not been found, and Sound/KIS/Container/ContainerB/Close as not been found. I went into the GameData folder, and checked the 'Sounds' folder, and all of the KIS and KAS sounds are there. And because of that, when I open a container and I'm not in the VAB or SPH, it will open for a second and then close again. This is really frustrating as I have to now attach the parts to my craft, increasing the mass, instead of putting them in easy to use containers.
Please post a pic of your gamedata folder. This is usually an install issue.

5 hours ago, ExplorerKlatt said:

Please post a pic of your gamedata folder. This is usually an install issue. 

Here it is: https://www.dropbox.com/s/7cewt2aza0s7i9h/gamedata pic.JPG?dl=0

Do you also want one of the issue in game?

I also had this problem, but I think I found the reason it doesn't work. Try double checking your module manager version, as well as the community category kit. I would redownload the KIS zip, unpack it, delete your old MM and CCK, and replace them with the ones found in the KIS folder.
